title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
Job Purpose: Solves organizational information problems and requirements by analyzing requirements; designing computer programs; recommending system controls and protocols.
Job Duties:
Determines operational objectives by studying business functions; gathering information; evaluating output requirements and formats.
Designs new computer programs by analyzing requirements; constructing workflow charts and diagrams; studying system capabilities; writing specifications.
Improves systems by studying current practices; designing modifications.
Recommends controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures.
Defines project requirements by identifying project milestones, phases, and elements; forming project team; establishing project budget.
Monitors project progress by tracking activity; resolving problems; publishing progress reports; recommending actions.
Maintains system protocols by writing and updating procedures.
Provides references for users by writing and maintaining user documentation; providing help desk support; training users.
Maintains user confidence and protects operations by keeping information confidential.
Prepares technical reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information and trends.
Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies.
Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.
Requirements:
A bachelor’s degree.
5 years’ experience.
Excellent documentation skills and toolkit of templates from previous work experience.
3 to 5 years of experience in business analysis/process improvement or related field.
Recommends controls by identifying problems; writing improved procedures.
SDLC, PMI – Methodology.
MS Office Required.

title: Business Systems Analyst IV
location: San Diego, CA 92131 (Miramar Ranch North area)
description:
Location: San Diego, CA Remote Location: # of openings: 1 Department: Employment duration: Full time Exemption Status: Exempt Relocation Assistance: N/A Added to system: 10/15/20 5:29 PM Job Code: 415.201015.6878
Description
Business Systems Analyst IV
MedImpact Healthcare Systems, Inc. is looking for extraordinary people to join our team!
Why join MedImpact? Because our success is dependent on you; innovative professionals with top notch skills who thrive on opportunity, high performance, and teamwork. We look for individuals who want to work on a team that cares about making a difference in the value of healthcare.
At MedImpact, we deliver leading edge pharmaceutical and technology related solutions that dramatically improve the value of health care. We provide superior outcomes to those we serve through innovative products, systems, and services that provide transparency and promote choice in decision making. Our vision is to set the standard in providing solutions that optimize satisfaction, service, cost, and quality in the healthcare industry. We are the premier Pharmacy Benefits Management solution!
The Scoop:
The position is a liaison between end-users/clients and the Technical Development team. The position is responsible for reviewing, analyzing, and evaluating complex business systems and user needs and maintaining a product backlog while prioritizing requirements. This individual formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies and writes user stories with clear and defined acceptance criteria.
What You Get To Do:
Supports the research, development and implementation of given Product and Services
Identifies, analyzes, monitors and suggests actions for products and services that materially contribute to the mission of the company
Conducts market and competitive analysis by retrieving information from a variety of sources, including but not limited to proprietary databases, Internet, focus groups and other data sources
Utilizes information retrieved to conduct research and analysis and presents results to leadership and product value teams
Completes all documentation throughout the product or project lifecycle, including creating business cases, business plans, business requirements, and product toolkits
Manages the conceptualization, design, product development and implementation of approved new and expanded products & services utilizing industry standard methodologies for product lifecycle management
Interviews end-users/customers to understand user needs and elicit business requirements
Helps anticipate user needs by performing in-depth analysis of data and gaining understanding of their work and pain points to consultatively suggest product functionality
Translates user needs into functional and data solutions in order to build desired user-centered functionality
Coordinates and collaborates with Business Owner and stakeholders, UX designers, and technical development teams to ensure requirements are understood and defined so that the software can build against those requirements
Defines and documents requirements business rules to assist in the development of software specifications to include system requirements, flow charts, report mock-ups, and business rules
Helps maintain a product backlog that aligns with the vision as defined and discussed with the Business Owner and stakeholders
Writes user stories with clear and well-defined acceptance criteria, so all members of the project team can understand the idea that is being conveyed and how it relates to the overall goal of the project
Actively participates in agile ceremonies of sprint planning and backlog grooming and attends daily scrum meetings
Ensures that the technical team works upon the priorities and monitors the progress of the items over the course of a sprint
Promotes continuous improvement by ensuring adherence to quality principles
Seeks out and actively participates in business initiatives that contribute to service excellence
Collaborates and cultivates positive relationships with internal and external customers through delivery of sustainable, measurable, accurate, reliable, and timely results that meet or exceed customer expectations
Education and/or Experience
For consideration, candidates will need a Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) and eight (8) to twelve (12) plus years of job-related experience in all the essential job functions listed
Ability to mentor and provide functional work direction to less experienced team members
Ability to create and maintain an implementable product roadmap that aligns with the overall vision of the product
Computer Skills
Visio, Golden 32, Secure CRT Design software and Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Access)
Unified Modeling Language; Oracle database; JAVA, SQL
Familiar with relational databases and client server concepts
Familiar with web distributed systems concepts
Other Skills and Abilities
Working knowledge of Agile software development life cycle (SDLC)
Familiar with Test-Driven Development (TDD) in SDLC
Solid business and technical understanding of supported MedImpact products and services.
Knowledge of Business Analysis Best Practices (BABOK)
Business Process Management techniques
Excellent project planning skills (quality, project scope and information management)
Negotiation and influencing skills
Business requirements gathering and elicitation techniques
Use Case Modeling & Solutions requirements
Activity and Swim Lane Diagrams
Change and conflict management skills
Leading and facilitating meetings
Good interpersonal and communications skills(written/verbal)
Interviewing skills to understand customer needs
Travel - This position may require domestic travel.
The Perks:
Medical / Dental / Vision / Wellness Programs
Paid Time Off / Company Paid Holidays
401K with Company match
Life and Disability Insurance
Tuition Reimbursement
Employee Referral Bonus
This position is eligible for Employee Referral Bonus at Level II
To explore all that MedImpact has to offer, and the greatness you can bring to our teams, please submit your resume to www.medimpact.com/careers
MedImpact, is a privately-held pharmacy benefit manager (PBM) headquartered in San Diego, California. Our solutions and services positively influence healthcare outcomes and expenditures, improving the position of our clients in the market. MedImpact offers high-value solutions to payers, providers and consumers of healthcare in the U.S. and foreign markets.
EOE, M/F/D/V

title: Business Systems Analyst - Salesforce
description:
Are you interested in joining an infectious company culture where accountability, top performance and teamwork are valued and rewarded? A company that was most recently named one of the Best Places to Work in Orange County by the Orange County Business Journal from 2016-2019.

TRI Pointe Group is looking for an experienced, enthusiastic individual to join our talented group as a Business Systems Analyst – Salesforce.

Position Highlights:
The Business Systems Analyst (BSA) provides enterprise-wide support for TRI Pointe Group Salesforce application for the Sales & Marketing CRM module. The BSA is the first line of support for end-users and the company’s foremost expert on Salesforce functionality and associated sales business processes. The BSA partners with IT Systems Analysts on the resolution of system issues, development of ad hoc reports, evaluation of enhancement requests and identification of solution options in Salesforce. The BSA works closely with business process owners, subject matter experts (SME’s), IT resources and third-party consultants to resolve issues and meet ongoing business needs.

The Sales and Marketing BSA is responsible for ensuring consistent standards for project management are applied across the organization. The BSA acts as a business partner to sales leadership in sales and marketing operations and provides the support and education necessary to ensure timely user adoption and accurate use of the CRM system.

The Sales and Marketing BSA leads process design reviews with business owners and SME’s to develop solutions that improve operating efficiencies and optimize the use of Salesforce. The BSA prepares functional specs for any custom development and tests and approves system changes for his/her functional area. The role is also responsible for maintaining and developing new educational materials and providing end-user training for the Salesforce software and associated business process.

Position Responsibilities:
Build the capabilities of end-users to perform lead management and sales module functions in the Salesforce system in an efficient, accurate and rigorous manner. Develop reference materials and provide training that establishes the required initial user acumen and can be leveraged for ongoing educational needs.
Provide end-user support as the escalation point for “Tier 2” help request. Prioritize and resolve system issues. Partner with business process owners to identify and prioritize future enhancement requests.
Work collaboratively with Executive Sales Operations and Digital Marketing teams, and other business partners to gather requirements and design business processes and operational reports in support of the lead management and sales modules.
Identify opportunities to improve business processes leveraging the Salesforce software. Implement processes that are accurate, streamlined, and well documented with an emphasis on delivering timely and accurate sales results.
Develop ad hoc and custom reports using Salesforce report development tools and work collaboratively with Business Intelligence team members to document requirements in developing Tableau dashboards and reporting produced from Salesforce data. Deliver reports that help optimize business performance, support internal controls and codify high leverage sales performance metrics.
Partner with other IT and Functional Business Systems Analysts on the integration of additional systems that share data to and from Salesforce.
Build the capabilities of end-users to access and use the data in a rigorous manner that is foundational to sound decision-making and ongoing sales reporting accuracy.
Other Duties as assigned.

Position Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in business administration or information management is required, other advanced degrees or credentials are preferred.
A minimum of 5 years of professional experience in Business Analyst role.
Hands on experience with Salesforce or other CRM system.
Strong working knowledge of Salesforce lead management and sales process modules.
Proven track record of leveraging information systems to drive process improvements.
Strong disposition for customer service supported by excellent interpersonal skills.
Experience with documenting functional requirements and design specifications for systems enhancements.
Familiarity with CRM practices for the sales homebuilding industry.
Committed to continuous process improvement – identifies improvement opportunities, makes recommendations, and drives implementation of solutions.
Ability to multi-task in a dynamic, high energy environment.
Proven analytical, conceptual and problem-solving abilities.
Proficient in standard business software, including Outlook, Excel, Word and PowerPoint.
Advanced skills in report development, business intelligence tools and application software preferred.
Passionate about business being done right – results are timely and accurate.
Works effectively in a collaborative environment with project team peers, leadership and end-users.
Effective at influencing leadership to make merit-based decisions that enable positive change.

Company Highlights:
As one of the top 10 largest public homebuilding companies by market capitalization in the United States, TRI Pointe Group combines the resources, operational sophistication, and leadership of a national organization with the regional insights, community ties, and agility of local homebuilders.

TRI Pointe Group was recognized in Fortune magazine’s 2017 100 Fastest-Growing Companies list, named 2016 Builder of the Year by Builder magazine

TRI Pointe Group has been named Builder of the Year, this time by Builder and Developer Magazine for 2019.

The TRI Pointe Group family includes MaracayÔ in Arizona, Pardee Homes® in California and Nevada, Quadrant Homes® in Washington, Trendmaker® Homes in Texas, TRI Pointe Homes® in California, Colorado and North Carolina, and Winchester® Homes* in the Washington, D.C. area.

For more information, please visit www.TriPointeGroup.com.

title: Business Systems Analyst
description:
Business Systems Analyst

As part of NEC's biometrics division, the Business Systems Analyst translates State and Local Law Enforcement business and client’s requirements into requirement specifications for our development team.
You will be the key interface between business, engineering & project management teams in defining and influencing business requirements and assists in developing the appropriate solutions. You will read RFP's and proposals. meet with customers to understand the business implications of technical solutions and then compare to our standard products and create requirements for new desired features. The BA then finalizes the business requirement docs and works towards agreement with customer. Once requirements are agreed upon and documented, the BA turns them over to the development team. You will stay engaged in the project through acceptance testing and client training.
This included leading requirements gathering sessions with non-technical business stakeholders; write business requirements definitions for technical developers (in Waterfall and Agile projects); summarize requirements for executive sponsors; conduct user acceptance testing and assist with facilitating user adoption through training and communication.

30%: Creating internal requirements documents and traceability matrices
Document results of business process and system application analysis
Flexibility in determining appropriate requirements capture and management methods including but not limited to use cases, user representations and storyboarding.
Work closely with delivery team to ensure end product aligns with requirements
Perform business process outcome modeling
Perform task and workflow analysis
Familiar with phases and deliverables associated with systems development lifecycle, both upstream and downstream from business requirements definition
Work within a project management framework and adhering to set deadlines

20%: Leading of cross functional teams in the design and facilitation of requirements elicitation sessions
Perform customer interviews
Perform customer survey to identify their expectations and requirements
Perform site visits
As part of a project team and along with customers, conducting requirements reviews
Effectively engage with customers to ensure their expectations align with SOW and final product

20% : Identifying gaps in requirements
Drive proactive sessions designed to help the business clarify process objectives to drive improvement to identify gaps and plan a solution to fill a gap

10% Reporting to Project Management on status/work of requirement analysis
10% Analyzing Change Requests vs requirements to recommend if a change is in scope
5% Working with customers to create use cases and work stories for new functionality
5% Review projects after closure to analyze missed/incorrect requirements

Required Skills & Experience
Extensive experience working in a business analyst role, including on initiatives that were large, complex cross-divisional, and/or multi-platform
Relationship management experience; works effectively with both engineering staff and business
Ability to develop, manage, and test business requirements from beginning to end.
.Highly self-motivated; able to work independently in situations where ambiguity is high
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills & first class customer service skill (written and oral)
Collaborative focus; experience with conflict management and bringing multiple stakeholders to common ground
Exposure to and appreciation of different cultures/workstyles/implications of varied time zones on project communications
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute work, balancing short-term needs and long-term goals
Application of attention to detail and quality assurance of own work and work of others
Can address tasks and issues on multiple projects and can identify and address areas of cross-functional impact
Familiarity with enterprise architecture
Awareness of process engineering and optimization functions; awareness of trends and direction in technology through training and communication.

Up to 25% travel
Biometrics/law enforcement background preferred but not required

ABOUT NEC CORPORATION OF AMERICA
Headquartered in Irving, Texas, NEC is a leading provider of innovative IT, biometrics, network, and communications products and solutions for service carriers and Fortune 1000 and SMB businesses across multiple vertical industries, including healthcare, government, education, and hospitality. NEC delivers one of the industry's broadest portfolios of technology solutions and professional services, including unified communications, wireless, voice and data, managed services, server and storage infrastructure, optical network systems, microwave radio communications, and biometric security. NEC is a wholly owned subsidiary of NEC Corporation, a global technology leader with a presence in over 44 countries and more than $37.5 billion in revenue.

NEC Corporation of America and its subsidiaries is committed to the maximum utilization of all human resources and the goal of Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action. We provide equal opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, genetic characteristics, height, weight, arrest record pertaining to misdemeanors or status as a Vietnam era or special disabled veteran, or any other class protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

EOE-Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

title: Business Systems Analyst (Adaptive)
location: San Francisco, CA (South of Market area)
description:
#TeamNextdoor
Nextdoor is the neighborhood hub for you, your neighbors and the broader local community. Nextdoor's purpose is to cultivate a kinder world where everyone has a neighborhood they can rely on.
Building connections in the real world is a universal human need. That truth, and the reality that neighborhoods are one of the most important and useful communities in our lives have been guiding principles for Nextdoor. Today, neighbors rely on Nextdoor in neighborhoods around the world in the United States, the United Kingdom, Germany, France, the Netherlands, Italy, Spain, Sweden, Denmark, Australia and Canada, with many more to come.
Meet your Future Neighbors
At Nextdoor, we believe in the transformative power of community. As the Information Systems team at Nextdoor is responsible for providing efficient platforms, workflows, and tools at scale for our internal customers in Finance, People, Neighborhood Operations and Sales & Marketing teams. We have developed various internal tools and workflows to help our Neighborhood operations team to support our members. As a software engineer, you will be responsible for building new tools or enhancing our existing tools.
The Impact You'll Make
As we scale and grow our business, we are looking for a Business Systems Analyst who can lead our financial systems initiatives. The key focus areas are Implementing and supporting Adaptive Insights, deploying Incentive compensation system and other Financial systems/tools.
As part of the Information systems team, you will play a crucial role in defining, architecting, and building the systems and features. You will work with various stakeholders in finance, accounting and people teams to prioritize business and information needs. You will also be partnering with other Information Systems team members who are subject matter experts in other business applications.
Day-to-day you should expect to be doing the following:
Analyze business requirements and translate them into effective and efficient application configuration.
Effectively communicate status updates and risk assessments to the management team
Maintain system integrations and troubleshoot problems as they arise
Configure user security profiles, assign and deactivate users, perform annual audits, and automate these tasks
Manage the vendor relationships with SaaS vendors and manage third party contractors for system implementations and support.
Develop a post-implementation support process and streamline the operational support model.
What You'll Bring to The House
Experience implementing, administering, and integrating SaaS software (Adaptive Insights Preferred)
3+ years of experience in related field with demonstrated results in delivering complex solutions
Experience with financial planning systems and domain a plus.
BS/MS in Finance, Accounting, Computer Sciences or other applicable majors - or relevant experience (Financial Planning experience strongly desired)
Great organizational skills and attention to detail; able to juggle and prioritize multiple tasks simultaneously
Proactive and forward-thinking attitude and creative problem-solving ability

title: Mortgage Business Analyst
description:
Infosys is seeking a Mortgage Business Analyst. Experience in Mortgage domain, especially Origination (Retail, Direct To Consumer, Correspondent, Wholesale), IT Business analysis and Agile experience.This resource will be joining our financial services domain consulting team, this is a specialized team with expertise in supporting Banking, Capital Markets, Cards & Payments, Mortgage etc domain projects. Candidate will be responsible to interface with end-users, IT teams and key stakeholders to gather system requirements. Will also apply technical proficiency across different stages of the Software Development Life Cycle including Requirements Elicitation; this opportunity is to be part of a learning culture, where teamwork and collaboration are encouraged, excellence is rewarded, and diversity is respected and valued.

Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or foreign equivalent required from an accredited institution. Will also consider three years of progressive experience in the specialty in lieu of every year of education.
At least 4 years of experience in Information Technology.
Candidate must be willing to relocate to either Irvine, CA. This position may also require relocation or travel to project locations.
U.S. citizens and those authorized to work in the U.S. are encouraged to apply.
Experience in Mortgage domain (Origination)
Experience as an IT Business Analyst/Product Owner with experience in requirement gathering/elicitation, Prioritize and sequence the user Stories Backlog, SQL skills

Preferred Qualifications
At least 5 years of Functional expertise in Mortgage Domain specially Origination (Retail, Direct To Consumer, Correspondent, Wholesale)
At least 4 years of experience in capturing user stories & requirements related to internal/external consulting, documenting, and mapping current business process
At least 5 years of experience in a client facing role as Business Analyst/Product Owner, requirement gathering, requirement elicitation, user stories.
At least 2 years of experience in Agile/Scrum, Prioritize and sequence the user stories Backlog according to business value or Return on Investment, Assist with the elaboration of Features into user stories including the Acceptance Criteria that are granular enough to be achieved in a single sprint, Participate in the daily Scrums, Sprint Planning Meetings and Sprint Reviews and Retrospectives
Demonstrated project management skills
Strong analytical skills with the ability to clearly articulate complexities
Extensive experience of driving results and collaborating in a cross-functional and global environment
Good communication, collaboration, presentation and influencing skills

Experience in Financial Services domain
Analytical skills
Experience and desire to work in a Global delivery environment.

The job entails sitting as well as working at a computer for extended periods of time. Should be able to communicate by telephone, email or face to face. Travel may be required as per the job requirements.

About Us
Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in 46 countries to navigate their digital transformation.

With over three decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises, we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills, expertise, and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.

To learn more about Infosys and see our ideas in action please visit us at www.Infosys.com

title: BI Analyst - Contractor
description:
WebMD/Medscape is searching for a Business Analyst to join our team!

A key and primary focus of the role will be performing k-means clustering analysis to identify clusters of data objects in large in-house data sets. As such extensive and proven experience in cluster analysis, preferably using Python, is essential. Experience in cluster analysis/advanced analytics with physician-level healthcare data would be desired.

What You Will Be Doing:
Performing advanced k-means clustering analysis.
Identify clusters of data objects in a dataset.
Create insightful, easy to understand reports that provide performance, trending and benchmarking analysis to meet business needs.
Provide ad-hoc analyses using various skills and tools to extract and aggregate data. Apply a broad range of analytical approaches, from back-of-envelope approximations to detailed deep dives in order to identify trends and new opportunities.
Collaborate with various business and operational groups to explore new feature ideas by mining existing web analytics data, designing A/B tests, and evaluating the results to produce recommendations and insights that will help shape business decisions.
Investigate significant changes in traffic and identify the cause of the changes through investigation using SQL or Excel.
Serve as a subject matter expert on data analysis and related best practices to business partners.
Create, maintain, automate, and enhance reporting template(s) and customize as needed.
Multi-task and understand priorities of requests and projects in a dynamic environment.

What's In It For You:
Besides a competitive compensation package, you'll be working with a great group of professionals in a culture that encourages innovation. If you're ready to take on some new challenges at a well-respected company, we'd love to hear from you.

What You Need For This Position:
2+ years’ experience in a hands-on analytical role with a focus on analyzing business problems.
Highly Proficient with creating, maintaining, and optimizing Tableau workbooks.
Proficient in tools used for data analysis and reporting (SQL, Excel).
Strong analytical, conceptual, and problem-solving abilities.
Knowledge of Python.

About Internet Brands:

Headquartered in El Segundo, Calif., Internet Brands® is a fully integrated online media and software services organization focused on four high-value vertical categories: Health, Automotive, Legal, and Home/Travel. The company's award-winning consumer websites lead their categories and serve more than 250 million monthly visitors, while a full range of web presence offerings has established deep, long-term relationships with SMB and enterprise clients. Internet Brands' powerful, proprietary operating platform provides the flexibility and scalability to fuel the company's continued growth. Internet Brands is a portfolio company of KKR and Temasek. For more information, please visit www.internetbrands.com.

Internet Brands and its wholly owned affiliates are an equal opportunity employer.

title: Sr. Business Systems Analyst
description:
Job Summary:
The primary purpose of the Senior IT Business Systems Analyst is to work as a liaison among enterprise applications business stakeholders in order to elicit, analyze, communicate and validate requirements for changes to business processes, policies and information systems, in conjunction with a strong understanding of the relevant technologies at an application administration level. Understands business problems and opportunities in the context of the requirements and recommends solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals. Interprets and transforms information based on business requirements and provides the data for delivery. Conducts detailed research of vendor products, assists with general project management and able to take on enterprise application administrative tasks.
In addition, the Senior IT Business Systems Analyst is expected to follow best practices and strive towards standardizing how work is managed and delivered. This includes regular status reporting, escalation of issues to business sponsors, and participation in driving the usability, efficiency and scalability of enterprise applications functionality.
The Senior IT Business Systems Analyst coaches and mentors other Business Systems Analysts.
Minimum Education & Experience:
Bachelor's degree in business information systems (IS), computer science or related field
Ten (10) years + of IT and/or Business experience in a Business Systems Analysis role
Ten (10) years + of experience working with internal clients and/or external agencies/partners
Proven experience working with the core business teams of Finance, HR, Legal, Sales & Marketing
Hands-on experience developing/administering relevant packaged or custom-applications
Experience administering Microsoft on-premise enterprise applications such as MS Dynamics Great Plains and/or MS Dynamics CRM would be a big plus
Experience administering SaaS enterprise applications such as Ultipro HRIS would be a big plus.
Any combination of education and the experience that would likely provide the required knowledge, skills, and abilities as well as possession of any required licenses or certifications is qualifying

Well-versed in Microsoft Office applications.
Understanding of various essential business functions of an organization.
Strong ability to facilitate process mapping activities and working knowledge of mapping techniques.
Strong understanding of the Internet, Intranet, Extranet and client/server architectures.
Strong understanding of how legacy and web-based system interfaces with each other.
Experience at working both independently and in a team-oriented, collaborative environment is essential.
Can conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills; expertise in setting and managing customer expectations

title: Sr. Business Solutions Analyst
description:
Overview:
As part of the Technology team, the Sr. Business Solution Analyst plays a key role in the successful delivery of our enterprise portfolio roadmap. This role is the primary interface between the Business Leaders and Technology teams, responsible for refining business objectives into business requirements and potential solutions providing the best user experiences possible, moving major enterprise project ideas from concept to delivery. This is a high-profile, leadership role that will bring repeatable best practices to Patelco to ensure delivery of high-quality financial experiences. Consensus-building is a critical facet of this role while leading large-scale planning, prioritization and trade-off discussions with a cross-functional team of business owners, designers, developers, testers, and vendors.
Responsibilities:
Gathers information from stakeholders to document business, process, functional, and/or data requirements. Ensure that product functionality is appropriately documented.
Work with stakeholders to understand and document the enterprise impact assessments
Work across the channels and products to ensure enterprise success
Own, prioritize, and maintain the work backlog, including definition of feature requirements and business outcomes, user stories, acceptance criteria
Member journey and process flows to deliver on outcome
Ensure cross-functional execution
Focusing on development of the technical solution
Serve as "voice of the member" with delivery teams, representing/reinforcing the member's perspective throughout the product realization cycle
Collaborate with a cross-functional team of business leaders, technical teams and vendors to ensure cross-functional execution against product roadmaps and release plans
Facilitates communication between the business teams, the technology team, and stakeholders and ensures the team is building the right solutions.
Continuously and transparently communicate with internal stakeholders the prioritization of the work stream backlog and the status of development efforts via product demos, release plans and other means
Define, prioritize, drive realization of specific product vision
Act as the subject-matter expert for assigned products
Work with Scrum Masters to help direct, motivate, and guide the development teams
Work with QA Resources to support development of a test plan, test scripts and organization of user acceptance test team. Leads and participates in user acceptance testing.
Provide direction and support to development and quality assurance teams
Promote and drive agile development methodology throughout the work and teams
Manage, prioritize, and assess the impact of defects, including providing key input on the decisions to fix or defer
Ensure that Scrum team deliverables meet agreed-upon standards for quality and non-functional requirements, and that the products meet the stated business need
Reviews output of development to ensure specified acceptance criteria has been completed
Provide input to Business Leaders for changes or product backlog items needed coming out of scrum development that need to be considered on the product roadmap
Assist customer support teams, learning and develop and assist to implement training programs and communications that allow partners and internal customers to better understand the products and changes that were made.
Obtains key inputs from technology teams and identifies solution interdependencies
In some cases, the Sr. Business Solution Analyst may be requested to manage projects
Qualifications:
Demonstrated ability to operate both strategically and tactically
Demonstrated ability to deal with ambiguity, with the ability to turn business strategy and analysis into processes and features that lead to desired business outcomes
Proactive problem-solving skills; ability to anticipate obstacles and quickly generate alternate solutions/ideas that support the business needs
Proven ability to lead, build relationships, and work effectively in a highly cross-functional organization with a variety of vendor/suppliers
Ability to consistently prioritize workflow with heavy emphasis based on business impact/value
Leading teams and management to decisions, diplomatic yet strong negotiation and conflict resolution skills
Adept at adjusting to changing circumstances quickly and professionally
Able to make quick decisions when clarification or modification is needed
Successful experience working independently
Demonstrable presentation, verbal and written communication skills
5-8+ years business systems analysis or relevant experience
5 years’ experience working as an agile product manager or product owner in a financial services company with proven history of full product development (or relevant work experience)
Working experience in the Lending and Financial Services industry required
Strong understanding and experience utilizing design-thinking best practices– empathy, requirements definition, ideation, prototyping, and testing to deliver products and experiences
Demonstrated knowledge of product feature lifecycle from concept through implementation
Demonstrable understanding of desktop and mobile user interface design, information architecture, user research, data visualization, analytics and APIs
Experience working with Scrum and SAFe development methodologies as a Portfolio Owner, Product Manager and/or Product Owner: writing and supporting business cases, feature descriptions, user stories, and following the development process from concept through production release and support
Experience working cross-functionally with business teams in complex projects
Bachelor’s degree preferred
IND123

title: Senior/Principal Business Analyst (Product Management)
description:
The Position

We are seeking mission-driven, passionate, self-starting, and creative individuals to join our diverse community of smart, fun, wholehearted, and engaged team. As a Business Analyst (BA) in Pharma Informatics US (USIX) you will work closely with our IT team and our business partners in the area of Commercial, Medical, and Government affairs. These organizations partner across the U.S.’s health care systems to deliver ever better health outcomes for patients while lowering overall healthcare costs.

We expect the Business Analyst to be a trusted partner to our business team with a passion for technology, and with proven Business System Analyst and Product Management capabilities . The Business Analyst must be an effective negotiator, leader, and communicator in working with Roche/Genentech’s multiple business units as well as with internal IT cross-functional teams. As a senior member of the community, the candidate is also accountable for the long term view and ROI of our products and is responsible for the planning and execution throughout the product lifecycle while ensuring that the product supports the company’s overall strategy, mission and goals.

The ideal candidate will be a self-starter with a passion for transforming healthcare, a high level of flexibility, and commitment. This person will share our community values of passion, courage, integrity, and gratitude -- all in service of our mission, “doing now what patients need next.”

The candidate selected for the position will be supporting one of the following Genentech's business areas :
Organized Customer Engagement (OCE) : The Organized Customer Engagement (OCE) Network within US Informatics is focused on partnering with the Market Access and Government Affairs organization as well as Brand Marketing within Genentech CMG (Commercial, Medical, and Government Affairs) to strategize and deliver IT solutions. This group focuses on technology partnership in support of all US Product Launches, as well as business functions that are accountable for product lifecycle management (eg, Channel Inventory and Distribution), operationalizing Commercial and Government contracts, processing financial commitments on these contracts, complying with government/regulatory reporting requirements, and evaluating impacts from new contracting strategies as well as regulatory changes.
Field Customer Engagement (FCE): Commercial area accountable for streamlining the customer(Health Care Professionals & health Care Organizations) engagement, enabling and incentivizing the field personnel to provide a seamless experience to the external customers, providing market strategies to keep Genentech competitive and creating analytical dashboards for operational, and planning purposes.
Patient Engagement (PE): The Patient Engagement Network is passionately focused on enabling seamless, consistent, and meaningful patient engagement. This team provides the digital, data, and technology partnership to business functions within Genentech CMG (Commercial, Medical Affairs, and Government Affairs) that work directly with patients, caregivers, and patient organizations. These functions range from providing patients access to our product to clinical trial site selection to drug safety automation .
Workplace and Employee Experience (WEX): The WEX Network is committed to providing a seamless workforce experience at Genentech. The WEX Network supports Corporate Functions (Legal, HR, Site Services, Corp Relations etc.) at Genentech, deliver End User Technology (Devices, Software Deployment, etc.) and provide a smooth frictionless employee experience via technology.

Responsibilities:
As a Principal/Sr Business Analyst/Product Manager on the USIX team, you will:
Influence senior leaders across Roche/Genentech be able to articulate, internalize and execute on our vision, strategy, goals and our progress
Have a broad knowledge and leverage the technical capabilities of the internal teams and external technology providers and vendors
Collaborate with IT Business Partners, Project Managers/Scrum Masters, Architects, Engineers, Developers, Quality Assurance, and User Experience Designers on scope, solutions, constraints, and risks
Analyze/document current and future business process models, high-level requirements (scope), and detailed functional specifications and/or stories; communicate to the lead developers and extended team effectively
Guide and support other Business Analyst and Product Managers as they develop the detail requirements (stories)
Perform knowledge transfer to training and communication teams and support user deployment activities as needed
Produce detailed wireframes and mockups using visualization tools for prototyping
Coach and mentor the BA community
Help develop the BA Center of Excellence

Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in Biology, Business, Information Systems or related field; Master degree in Business, or Science is preferred
Overall 7+ years experience as Business Analyst and product management
Strong hands-on and leadership experience in deploying a board set of technologies end to end
Experience and understanding of application development methodology - including Agile and Waterfall approaches, functional requirements, process modeling, and re-engineering, use case development, user acceptance testing, organizational change management, and large-scale system implementations
Demonstrated success in handling initiatives of high complexity, high profile and large scale programs
Proven skills in relationship building, influencing, customer-focus, decision-making, and problem-solving
Demonstrated ability to quickly learn the business in unfamiliar areas
Ability to work in an environment of competing and alternating priorities with a constant focus on delivery
Excellent communication (written and oral) and presentation skills; solid business acumen; well-honed influencing skills are essential
Self-motivated and team-oriented; able to work both autonomously and effectively as part of a geographically dispersed team
Experience with Jira, Confluence and other Agile tools preferred
Proven leadership abilities and emotional intelligence

#ITcareers

#LI-PK1
Who We Are
Genentech, a member of the Roche group and founder of the biotechnology industry, is dedicated to pursuing groundbreaking science to discover and develop medicines for people with serious and life-threatening diseases. To solve the world's most complex health challenges, we ask bigger questions that challenge our industry and the boundaries of science to transform society. Our transformational discoveries include the first targeted antibody for cancer and the first medicine for primary progressive multiple sclerosis.
Diversity and Inclusion (D&I) are critical to the success of our company and our impact on society. We believe that by championing diversity of background, thought and experience, we can foster a sense of belonging and provide an environment where every employee feels valued, included, and able to contribute their best for the patients we serve. We’re focused on attracting, retaining, developing and advancing our people to their full potential by rewarding bold ways of thinking and integrating inclusive behaviors into every aspect of our work.
The next step is yours. To apply today, click on the "Apply for this job" button.
Genentech is an equal opportunity employer & prohibits unlawful discrimination based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, age, disability, marital & veteran status. For more information about equal employment opportunity, visit our Genentech Careers page . Job Facts JOB FUNCTION

title: Technical Salesforce Business Systems Analyst
description:
Email is the universal communication tool for work. It’s where you discuss work, answer questions, and talk to all of your customers, vendors, and partners. But email wasn’t designed for business and hasn’t evolved with the way you work with a team. So you’re dropping the ball, missing important context, and relying on dozens of siloed apps just to get the job done.

With more than 6,000 customers and $30M+ in revenue, Front is reinventing the inbox so people can accomplish more together. We’ve created one place where you communicate internally and externally, gain context about customers and projects, and access all your other tools so you can be more efficient, more fulfilled, and ultimately happier at work.

With $138M in funding, Front is backed by Sequoia Capital, and other leading venture capital firms, as well as independent investors including top executives of Atlassian, Okta, Qualtrics, and Zoom. Front was recently named to the Forbes Cloud 100 2020, the definitive list of the top software companies in the world. We have also been recognized on LinkedIn’s 2020 Top Startups, Forbes’ Next Billion-Dollar Startups 2019, The New York Times’ The Next Wave of ‘Unicorn’ Start-Ups, Fortune’s Best Small Workplaces, and Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work.

As a Technical Business Systems Analyst, you will play a key role at Front working cross functionally as we transform our go-to-market capabilities. You will be part of the core team that is responsible for designing, building, and maintaining the Salesforce platform and related technologies. This is a great opportunity for someone with a strong background configuring complex systems who enjoys working in a challenging and fast-paced environment.

This position will be based in our San Francisco HQ.
What will you be doing?
Be the functional point person for internal customers as the subject matter expert on all sales platforms, integrations, and data sources.
Provide strong analytical, problem solving, and technical skills to effectively collaborate with business stakeholders to gather requirements and deploy high quality solutions.
Own functional tasks and deliverables, including: process definition and re-engineering, high-level and detail-level requirements gathering, build, testing(QA and UAT), and continuous improvement and maintenance of business applications.
Provide post-production support and bug resolution while delivering best in class support to our business partners.
Ensure that high quality data is going into our systems and being utilized appropriately.
Use and recommend best practices while delivering scalable solutions that enable key business goals
What skills and experience do you need?
You are a certified Salesforce Administrator and you have experience with Sales Cloud and Lightning framework.
You have 2+ years of hands-on work in Salesforce as an Analyst/Administrator including experience with related tools/platforms; you have experience analyzing, configuring and supporting Salesforce implementations and can manage and implement advanced configurations such as custom objects, fields, formulas, validation rules, and process automations.
You are detail-oriented, organized, self-motivated, hard working, and a great team player with excellent interpersonal skills.
You can explain complex systems and technical topics in a clear, concise manner to others who may have minimal technical knowledge.
You have strong written/verbal communication skills and can translate business requirements and engage directly with business stakeholders.
You are a good problem solver and critical thinker with an appreciation for simple high quality solutions.
You like to learn and apply new technologies.
You have previous experience in B2B SaaS with a subscription environment for recurring revenue products.
You care about the business impact of your technical work.
Bonus:
You have experience with Salesforce CPQ(SteelBrick)
You have experience working with Agile methodologies

Front provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability.

title: Technical Business Analyst, Integrations
description:
Position Overview:
ClosingCorp, a leading provider of residential real estate closing cost data and technologies, is looking for an individual to join our team as a Technical Business Analyst for Integrations.
This role will lead integration projects and ensure partner solutions are clearly understood and desired outcomes achieved. Working with internal stakeholders and external clients to clarify and document requirements, changes to specifications and workflow solutions, a successful candidate will facilitate collaborative and accountable partnerships and outcomes that meet all party's business needs related to connectivity and integrations.
The selected candidate will need to quickly acquire a deep knowledge of ClosingCorp's products, services, and a clear understanding of our business model. They will work on multiple projects from across several of the ClosingCorp product lines and will need to be comfortable discussing various technical implementation options.
The Integration Analyst will work with ClosingCorp's Sales, Client Services, Product, Provider Services, Onboarding, Client Support, and Engineering teams in a collaborative effort to deliver the defined solution.
General Duties and Responsibilities:
Acts as an integrations subject matter expert to assist Client Services and Support teams
Works individually or within a team on integration projects to meet specific client requirements.
Maintains client specific documentation such as updating the client workflow, creating and maintaining the client solutions document
Assists in maintaining internal documentation including sequence diagrams, workflows, data dictionary, iGuides, and Schemas
Assists in maintaining external documentation on the Self-Serve Document Portal
Expertly researches and documents client needs, technology or regulations related to system design
Analyzes system impacts to other internal and external systems or processes and procedures
Shares new client requests with Client Services for possible submission to intake committee
Works with Client Services to develop agenda items for Monthly Base Integration Relationship calls and to fulfill related action items
Writes test plans and conducts a variety of test cases to confirm the outcomes of the requirement changes meet the expectations of the business partners and clients
Writes test plans and test cases to ensure enhancements made to applications meet client needs and that application integrity is maintained.
Assists in testing integrations prior to ClosingCorp monthly releases and/or the client's release
Works with the Product team to help define client requested product features, the strategic value, and high level system requirements
Provide strong support to clients and internal team members to ensure successful "Go Live" with our products and services which may require after normal business hour coverage including weekends surrounding these events
Performs other related duties as required
Required Experience and Skills:
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to present technical and non-technical information to any audience
Ability to provide excellent customer service to business partners and clients to ensure project success and client satisfaction
Excellent analytical, decision-making, problem-solving, interpersonal, team, conflict management and time management skills
Knowledge of systems development life cycles such as Agile, Waterfall, Prototyping, etc.
Ability to implement solutions and technical requirements by leveraging the appropriate tools and techniques
Ability to research ideas and present outcomes in a clear and concise manner
Proficiency in business modeling and requirements definition disciplines through Unified Modeling Language (UML), use cases, etc.
Proficiency in quality management methods, tools and technologies
Familiarity with reading and testing XML and/or JSON
Preferred Education and Industry Knowledge:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration or the equivalent combination of education, training, or work experience
Knowledge of financial services industry, including Point of Sale and Loan Origination Systems
Familiarity with general industry regulations including TRID and RESPA
Familiarity with MISMO standards and documentation

title: Senior Business Reporting Analyst
description:
Overview:
CARRINGTON IS A ESSENTIAL BUSINESS- PLEASE APPLY!
Carrington Mortgage Services is a fully integrated mortgage company with mortgage lending and servicing operations and an affiliated real estate brokerage. We are part of Carrington Holding Company, LLC , which owns and operates multiple businesses that cover virtually every aspect of single family residential real estate transactions.
What We Offer:
Comprehensive healthcare plans for you and your family.
Access to discounts through our employee portal.
Customized training programs to help you advance your career .
Employee referral bonuses so you’ll get the opportunity to work with friends (and get some extra cash in your pocket!).
Educational Reimbursement.

Come join our amazing team and work remote through the pandemic.
Responsibilities:
The Senior Reporting Analyst will be responsible for providing superior reporting, Business Intelligence (BI) and data analysis support to division management. Consult with business leaders and propose solutions to complex business needs. Extract data, validate and interpret results, and recommend solutions. Assist lower level Analysts as needed. Perform all duties in accordance with the company’s policies and procedures, all US state and federal laws and regulations, wherein the company operates.

What you'll do:

Design, develop, and build reports initiated from business units’ management team.
Gather requirements, ask questions, problem solve and extract data and develop recommendations to provide possible solutions to the business needs.
Consult with business leaders and propose solutions to complex business needs.
Develop and design reports that are representative of the business unit’s productivity.
Perform data validation and analysis of all report data to ensure accuracy.
Create operational and ad-hoc reports and data extracts to support business processes.
Utilize various tools such as SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS), Excel, PowerBI, Motivity for data analysis and reporting as well as proprietary reporting tools integrated in business applications.
Work closely with management, end-users and IT in the analysis of business requirements to deliver effective business intelligence reporting solutions.
Develop reports using historical or real-time data to support timeline business decisions.
Create a variety of highly complex reporting solutions such as operational reports, scorecards, or dashboards to visualize business unit performance and trends.
Create and maintain documentation of processes, reports, applications, and procedures.
Develop and maintain regularly scheduled reports.
Qualifications:
What you'll need:
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent work experience in business intelligence, report development, or data analysis.
5 + years’ experience as a Business Systems Analyst, Financial Analyst, Reporting Analyst, Operations Analyst or similar role.
Mortgage lending background preferred.
Motivity experience preferred.
Experience with SQL server database management systems preferred
Team-player with strong communication and interpersonal skills, possess a high degree of self-motivation and ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Ability to understand and solve complex problems using a variety of tools, including Excel, PowerBI, and SSRS

title: Senior Business Process Analyst, Salesforce
description:
Additional Locations:
Purpose and Passion • Comprehensive Benefits • Life-Work Integration • Community • Career Growth
At Boston Scientific, you will find a collaborative culture driven by a passion for innovation that keeps us connected on the most essential level. With determination, imagination and a deep caring for human life, we’re solving some of the most important healthcare industry challenges. Together, we’re one global team committed to making a difference in people’s lives around the world. This is a place where you can find a career with meaningful purpose—improving lives through your life’s work.
Senior Business Process Analyst, Salesforce
About the role:
The Senior Business Process Analyst will plan and perform business process reviews to support our Neuromodulation division. Our division is a global leader in meaningful, industry-leading solutions for Chronic Pain and Neurological diseases. You will support the development, implementation, deployment and adoption of SFDC products (Sales, Service, Community, Health, Einstein Analytics, Marketing clouds) and other business tools (SAP, Tableau, Informatica, etc.). The Sr Business Process Analyst will be passionate about delivering measurable results and enjoy working on a wide variety of projects in a highly collaborative environment.
Your responsibilities will include:
Collaborate with Sales, Marketing, Operations, Finance and IT to identify and define a problem; collect and analyze data pertaining to it; evaluate current processes and procedures; prioritize current business needs; and collaborate to create SFDC solutions to meet these needs
Understand voice of business/users and understand business processes
Adheres to project implementation governance, and develops and maintains project plans, tasks, deliverables, dependencies and resource requirements.
Appropriately communicates project status, escalates issues, and manages timelines and action items.
Identifies opportunities for business process improvements and establishes effective and efficient processes, including prioritizing demand.
Works closely with the product team (internal and external) to assure a timely solution is delivered according to the specifications and implementation needs of the business.
Drives data integrity in Salesforce.com platform to support forecasting accuracy.
Evaluate features and solutions tactically and strategically, design solutions with entire ecosystem in mind
Participates in special projects as. they arise, including compliance reviews, financial audits, and due diligence reviews.
Supports field organization analyze and develop solutions for our customers through business processes and technology improvement.
Collaborate with the various business units (Sales, Marketing, Ops, Business Development, etc.) to scope out future business use-cases
Gather and capture user requirements
Support product development and deployment process
Perform formal user acceptance testing
Stay current on new features, functionality, and application capabilities of Salesforce.com to address business requirements
What we’re looking for in you:
Minimum Qualifications
BA/BS degree
3+ years of Salesforce.com or related Customer Relationship Management software experience
3+ years of business operations improvement experience
2+ Years of Agile Experience
Experience working with JIRA, ERP, CRM, BI solutions
Strong data analysis skills; able to collect and analyze business information and draw accurate conclusions
Strong communication, collaboration, and presentation skills
Highly organization, planning and multitasking skills
Preferred Qualifications
Medical device experience
SFDC Admin certification

About us
As a global medical technology leader for more than 35 years, our mission at Boston Scientific (NYSE: BSX) is to transform lives through innovative medical solutions that improve the health of patients. If you’re looking to truly make a difference to people both around the world and around the corner, there’s no better place to make it happen.

Nearest Major Market: Los Angeles

title: Sr. Business System Analyst - Opportunity for Working Remotely Palo Alto, CA
description:
VMware (NYSE: VMW) is the global leader in virtualization solutions from the desktop to the datacenter. VMware software powers the world’s complex digital infrastructure. Our cloud, networking, security, and digital workspace solutions form a digital foundation that delivers any app on any cloud to any device. We streamline the journey to become digital businesses for more than 500,000 customers and 20,000 partners worldwide. VMware’s award-winning technology, market-leading position and culture of excellence provide the more than 25000+ passionate people we employ in 120+ locations worldwide with a platform for professional growth and the excitement of being an early-stage innovator.
VMware IT HR, Legal & REW Group
Our team supports VMware HR, Legal and REW business functions with platforms and systems capabilities. We are transforming our software delivery practices to bring in greater agility. We also use mobile and IoT technologies to deliver new digital experiences for employees, customers and partners. You will team up with a geographically distributed team of Engineers, Product Managers, QE and DevOps staff in Bangalore, Palo Alto, Austin and Costa Rica. You will bring your technical experience / expertise in web-based/mobile applications development and drive the adoption of standard methodologies as we build a scalable platform for business requirements.
About You
You love applying technical expertise to significant programming and design problems
You love working with some of the best engineers, product managers and architects around the world
You normally set high standards for yourself and strive to excel and to innovate
Team work is your forte and you like to challenge the status quo. Question why we do things.
Responsibilities

title: Sr. Business Systems Analyst (NetSuite)
description:
ABOUT FUNIMATION
Funimation creates extraordinary anime experiences for tens of millions of people around the world every day. For over 25 years, Funimation has been the market leader, serving a passionate fan community whenever, and wherever they want it. We deliver the best that anime has to offer across television, feature films, events, retail, merchandise and, of course, the Funimation subscription apps, which are available on 15 platforms in 47 countries. Our culture is high-energy and our approach is deeply customer-obsessed, with top talent from across the full spectrum of media, tech, gaming and entertainment. With over 400 employees in 6 countries, Funimation is rapidly expanding and looking for passionate, innovative leaders to join our team.
Funimation is an independently-operated joint venture between Sony Pictures Entertainment US, and Aniplex JP, a subsidiary of Sony Music Entertainment Japan, Inc. To learn more about Funimation, visit funimation.com and follow us on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.
THE ROLE
Funimation is looking for a Sr. Business Systems Analyst (Netsuite) to join our team. We're looking for an experienced and motivated NetSuite System Analyst to help us support our core ERP system, as well as peripheral financial systems. As a Business Systems Analyst you will be a shared owner of the vision for our financial systems. The ideal candidate should have a solid analytical mindset, excellent interpersonal communications, diligent time management skills, be team-oriented and have a strong work ethic. This role will assist other business systems analysts across IT for strategic and business as usual projects.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Collaborate with key individual contributors within the Finance and IT teams to solve key business problems by either driving process change or making systematic recommendations for delivery
Prepare and review documentation for current processes, pain points, and assumptions for finance systems and continuously identify gaps and opportunities for automation projects that will streamline workflows and processes within accounting
Assist in design and system configuration within NetSuite, and other key financial systems.
Assist in the ongoing administration of NetSuite and Concur (preferred) including user roles and permissions, item configuration, reporting changes, and related administration duties
Perform complex business and systems analysis work, root cause analysis and provide forward thinking, long term technical solutions; conduct requirements gathering/analysis following the Agile methodology
Assist in cross-functional requirement sessions to elicit, document and analyze business requirements and functional specifications. Includes identifying unspoken or conflicting requirements and challenging the norm
Assist in building innovative solutions that automate and scale Okta business systems for the accounting and revenue operations team
Maintain our critical business systems: coordinate system upgrade activity, respond to issues and incidents and provide day-to-day administration of the critical business systems that drive our global finance operations
Draw from your experience to recommend changes in development, maintenance and system standards
Support for key month end close processes
REQUIREMENTS
Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, IT, or other analytics-related fields.
Minimum 5 years of relevant experience
Minimum 3 years of administration experience in NetSuite
Experience with designing and supporting NetSuite integration with other business systems like Concur, Hyperion, Adaptive, HRIS systems etc.
Experience working with systems that handle sensitive data and with SOX controls and change management processes
Experience with subscription models, and recurring billing systems
A good understanding of key financial business processes (Billing, Collections, sales compensation, Revenue Management, Procure-to-Pay, Quote-to-Cash)
Exceptional communication skills, and ability to convey complex ideas in a clear, concise fashion to both technical and non-technical audiences
Strong problem solving and analytical/critical thinking skills needed
Work ethic: You do what it takes to make a project go well. You are equally comfortable taking personal ownership for a task as delegating it
Must have legal right to work in the U.S.
Funimation offers competitive compensation along with a comprehensive benefits package to include health, dental, vision, life, short & long-term disability, 401(k) with a generous company match, ongoing employee development.
Funimation is an Equal Opportunity Employer
Sony Pictures Entertainment is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other protected characteristics.

title: (Salesforce), Sales/Operations Business Systems Analyst III
description:
Accelerate Your Career

Drive global technology

With more than $2 billion in revenues, CDK Global is a leading global provider of integrated information technology and digital marketing solutions to the automotive retail and adjacent industries. Focused on enabling end-to-end automotive commerce, CDK provides solutions to dealers in more than 100 countries around the world, serving approximately 28,000 retail locations and most automotive manufacturers. CDK Global solutions automate and integrate critical processes from pre-sale targeted advertising to the sale, financing, insurance, parts supply, repair and maintenance of vehicles, with an increasing focus on utilizing data analytics and predictive intelligence.

Were large enough to make a difference but small enough for your voice to be heard. This means that we are an organization where every person matters. You can make an impact on the success of our business and that of our customers regardless of what career you decide to pursue.

From data scientists to sales and client service experts, were hiring to support your growth and ours - Green light your career.

Under general supervision, the Business Systems Analyst III is responsible for the analysis and evaluation of user business problems and the development of system recommendations in Salesforce and other related tools to meet business area requirements. This jobs contributions are typically in regards to the fulfillment of projects and organization objectives using judgement within defined practices and procedures to accomplish moderately difficult projects.

The candidate will work with Sales leaders at all levels of the organization in order to help increase utilization of Salesforce and help to carry out processes that are/ will be based within the tool. This position also includes the daily administration and support of Salesforce in partnership with our IT department.

Position Responsibilities & Essential functions
Develop automation and process improvement opportunities through tasks, process builder workflows, validation rules and/or alerts to improve the effectiveness and usability of Salesforce.
Responsible for the analysis and evaluation of user business problems and the development of system recommendations to meet business area requirements.
Overseeing business processes, analyzing areas of opportunity, data structure and reporting through use of Salesforce Analytics and Salesforce Einstein.
Defines problems, evaluates and prioritizes requirements, and implements systems to meet internal business and user requirements for routine projects.
Own the system adoption process with support from IT.
Assist in the software testing process, which includes devising test plans, creating test cases, establishing protocols and appropriate testing environments and coordinating user acceptance testing.
Provides recommendations to address specific business needs for IT-based solutions.
Collaborates with multiple cross-functional areas externally and internally for the implementation of system and business processes.
Plans and configures system settings and options for both Salesforce and homegrown sales enablement applications.
May evaluate new software products to determine their applicability to current and future IT and Sales environments.
Exercises judgement within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate actions when accomplishing objectives.
Keeping abreast of new Salesforce features and functionality and providing recommendations for process improvements.
Qualifications & Job Requirements
Minimum of 5 years hands-on experience with Salesforce
Salesforce Certified Administrator
Bachelors degree in business, Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering or related scientific or technical discipline
Hands-on development experience with Salesforce.com, Force.com, APEX, Visualforce applications, including Salesforce Service and Sales Cloud Administration
Strong technical knowledge of Salesforce.com which allows for effective communication w/ IT partners (SFDC)
Solid communicator who can work effectively in a collaborative but deadline-driven environment and can effectively adapt to changing technology and apply it to business needs
Results oriented with a strong drive to accomplish objectives and meet high standards
Excellent organizational, verbal and written communication skills
PREFERRED ATTRIBUTES & Qualifications
Salesforce Einstein Analytics Certification
Working knowledge and experience with complex business systems integration as well as object-oriented design patterns and development
Show persistence when setting and working towards personal and team goals
Experience with Agile development methodologies such as XP/SCRUM
Demonstrated experience and knowledge of relational databases, data modeling, and ETL tools
Direct experience working on CRM projects for enterprise size companies
CDK Global knows you have passions outside of work. You have family, friends, sporting events, and lots of things going on. Thats why we offer a comprehensive benefits package to not only take care of you but your family as well. All of our benefits are effective the first day of employment including 401K matching, paid time off to re-energize, donate your time to volunteer in your community, and tuition reimbursement to name a few.

At CDK, we pride ourselves on having a diverse workforce. We value and celebrate the uniqueness of individuals and the different perspectives they provide. We offer equal opportunity employment regardless of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, or protected veteran status.

title: Senior Business Systems Analyst
description:
At eXcell, we set you up for job success right from the start. Our precision recruiting process aligns the right fit for the right people.

The Senior Business Systems Analyst will provide support for projects within the client’s project portfolio. The projects may be related to system modernization, facility management system, records inquiry system, data exchanges and conversion, and other projects as assigned throughout the contract period.

Overview: Provide leadership, support, and guidance to project and group team members as needed to deliver tasks, meet objectives, and promote best practices. Manage project life cycle requirements: trace, maintain, prioritize, assess requirement changes, and approve requirements. Support the project team and deliver business system analysis documentation and other artifacts as required within the timeline of the individual projects assigned.

Tasks & Deliverables:
Lead a Business System Analyst team to provide support for creation and delivery of documentation, business and system requirements, specifications, attributes, strategic analysis, functional testing, and solution evaluation of project interfaces as scheduled per the project plan:
Create an interface control document that provides the source and target systems, elements, and attributes
Collaborate with relevant teams on designing data exchange interfaces
Work with business departments, including technical teams, in developing and confirming data sources, user workflows, and maps to populate interfaces
Successfully and accurately complete all interface documentation per the timeline indicated in the project schedule
Create and deliver project artifacts / documentation that meet the established PM Center of Excellence standards
Deliver assigned tasks within the time-frame indicated on the project schedule(s)
Collaborate and meet closely with stakeholders to elicit, educate, update, and deliver business, system process, and systems requirements documentation for projects assigned
Read and review system design documents, use cases, future business processes, etc. for clarity and validation of correct information
Create test plans, scripts, functional and technical specifications, sequence diagrams, process flows, requirement traceability matrices, etc. as needed for each project assigned
Work with the IT Resource Manager to improve current BA project processes, templates, and perform quality reviews of peer / team submitted documentation; ensuring data is reliable and valid within the projects assigned
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business, or related field
Six (6) years of experience providing technical and/or analytical support in the functional area(s) being supported
OR training and experience equivalent to a degree in relevant analytical, administrative, lead, supervisory, or management experience that includes interpreting rules and regulations, gathering data and formulating recommendations, and report writing
Experience working with public agencies and law enforcement a plus

We will consider for employment all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, arrest, and conviction records in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable state and local laws. This includes the City of Los Angeles Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance as well as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

W2 only, no Corp to Corp. We are unable to sponsor H1B visas at this time. **eXcell™ Supports Equal Employment Opportunity** eXcell™, a division of CompuCom® Systems, Inc., a global company headquartered in Bellevue, Washington, provides IT staffing services and solutions to Fortune 1000 companies as well as small and medium business. For more information, visit www.excell.com.

description:
